div.span: Adapted from Inventory of Greek Coin Hoards

div.pre: 1636 Mit Rahineh, near Memphis, 20 km. (722) S of Cairo, 1860 Burial: c. 500 B.C. (Jenkins) Contents: 23+ AR, 73 kg. Hacksilber. Found near Ptah temple Potidaea: 1 tetradr. frag. Lete: 1 st. Thraco-Maced.: 2 st. (bull 1, Pegasus 1) Dicaea Thraciae: 1 st. Aegina: 1 st. Corinth: 2 st.; 2 frag. Naxos: 2 st. frag. Paros: 1 st. Chios: 1 st. Cos: 1 dr. Caria: 1 fr.; 1 frag. (as SNGBerry 1080) Cyprus: 1 st. Cyrene: 2 tetradr. Unc.: 1 st. (two grape bunches-Cyclades?) 2 dr. (bee-Cyclades? I; boar hd. as SNGvonA. 6663 1) Disposition: Alexandria â€ de Longperier, RN 1861, pp. 414-28, illus. (engraving) = Oevres II (1883), p. 514 (no. 1 = Potidaea; no. 2 = Paros; nos. 5, 14 = Thraco-Maced.; nos. 15-16 = Caria; no. 18 = Dicaea; nos. 10-11, 20 = unc.) Dressel, ZfN 1900, p. 254 Regling, RE 7, col. 976 Schlumberger, L'argent grec, p. 10, no. 34 May, NC 1965, pp. 1-25, no. 8(? no. 4) Hd. possibly also contained 1 double-shekel and 2 shekels of Sidon, and 5 sigloi of Persia, which although not mentioned by Longperier were included in a set of casts of this hd. furnished by Alex- andria museum-in which case cf. Sakha hd. (no. 1639 below)-but this cannot be certainly determined
